The problem features nouns and personal pronouns.

the fourth (required in Assignment 2) will have to be constructed by analogy:
* 1st person single: bi
* 1st person plural: (bu)
* 2nd person single: si
* 2ns person single: su 

All expressions in the problem denote something (X) belonging to someone or something else (Y). 
The possessor (Y) comes first, unmarked. 
The possessee (X) reccives a suffix (-i, -ni, -u) indicating the possessor's person and number. 
This marker may be preceded by the suffix -ni, which indicates that the possession is alienable (that is, the possessed and the possessor are not in a part-whole relationship). 
Two occurrences of the vowel i merge into i: on a suffix boundary.
If there are two possessors with different possessees (e.g, 'thy son's shoulder), each gets the appropriate sulfixes. 
If there are two possssors with the same possessee ('my boar head', 'rour cow thigh), the possessee gets a suffix which indicates the current possessor, that is, the of which it is not a part.
